subject: Technology
title: Nintendo vs Sega: The Original Console War
description: A fast breakdown of Nintendo vs Sega: The Original Console War for builders.

hook.text: In the late 1980s, Nintendo owned 90% of the console market. Then a blue hedgehog arrived.

buildup.text: Sega launched the Genesis with Sonic the Hedgehog. Their slogan: 'Genesis does what Nintendon't.'

discovery.text: Sega marketed itself as the cool, edgy choice for older kids. Nintendo was for babies, they claimed.

twist.text: The rivalry pushed both companies to make better games. Competition raised the quality of the entire industry.

climax.text: Sega eventually left the console business entirely. But the war proved gaming needed healthy competition.

punchline.text: Sega lost the war but made the entire industry better.

quiz.question: What was Sega's famous marketing slogan against Nintendo?
